part2.question:
Describe a creative person whose work you admire (e.g., artist or musician). You should say:
Who this person is
How you knew him/her
What creative work he/she does
And explain why you admire him/her.
part2.model_answer: I'd like to talk about a creative person I greatly admire, who is a famous landscape painter from my hometown. I first knew about him when I visited a local art gallery during a high school trip. He creates breathtaking oil paintings that capture the natural beauty and Spirit of our region perfectly. I admire him because his work is truly Visionary [有远见的] and Exceptional [杰出的], showing a deep connection to nature. He is incredibly Dedicated [专注的] to his craft, spending hours outdoors in all weather to get the perfect light. His Innovative [创新的] techniques inspire me to be more creative.

part2.question:
Describe a person who has a natural talent (e.g., for sports, music, or math). You should say:
Who the person is
What talent they possess
When you discovered this talent
And explain whether you think they use this talent well.
part2.model_answer: My cousin is someone who has a natural [天生好手] talent for playing the piano beautifully. I discovered this amazing ability when she sat down at a piano at a party and played a complex classical piece perfectly without ever having taken a single lesson. She is definitely A natural [天生好手] musician. I think she uses this talent well because she now teaches music to young children, sharing her gift with others and bringing joy to the community. She is also very Versatile [多才多艺的] and can play jazz and pop songs with ease too.

part2.question:
Describe a person who solved a problem in a clever way. You should say:
Who the person is
What the problem was
How they solved it
And explain why you think their solution was intelligent.
part2.model_answer: A friend of mine solved a difficult math problem in a very clever way during our final exam. The problem seemed impossible to solve with standard formulas, but he used a simple logical trick instead. He realized that the answer could be found by looking at the pattern of numbers. I think his solution was intelligent because it showed he could Think on his feet and find a creative shortcut. His Spontaneous [自发的] thinking saved him a lot of time and effort during the stressful exam. It was a brilliant moment of insight that I will never forget.

part3.question: How can we know if a child has talent or not?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] A child's Potential [潜力] can often be seen early if they have an Innate [天生的] interest in something. [Reason] Some children naturally gravitate towards music, art, or sports without prompting. [Example] A toddler banging on pots in rhythm might have musical talent waiting to be developed. [Extension] Observing their free play is key to discovery.

part3.question: Is it a waste of time if people don't use their talents?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Not using one's Ingenuity [独创性] is unfortunate for both the individual and society. [Reason] Creative problem solving can help in many areas of life, not just art. [Example] Even in simple daily tasks, a clever approach saves time and effort for everyone. [Extension] Society benefits when people use their unique creative skills fully and effectively.

part3.question: Are children born smart, or do they become smart through learning?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] I believe Nurture [培养] is more important than nature because Practice makes perfect [熟能生巧]. [Reason] Even a genius needs training and discipline to succeed in the long run. [Example] Top athletes train for hours daily regardless of their natural physical ability. [Extension] Hard work beats talent when talent doesn't work hard enough to succeed.

part3.question: Is being intelligent always a good thing? Are there limitations?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Being Brainy [聪明的] or having high Intelligence [智力] is generally good but has social limits. [Reason] Smart people sometimes lack social skills or empathy for others' feelings. [Example] A genius might solve equations easily but fail to make friends or connect emotionally. [Extension] A balance of IQ and EQ is best for a successful life.

part3.question: Do you think the education system stifles creativity by focusing too much on academic scores?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] The Academic [学术的] system often focuses too much on standardized testing and Preparation [准备] for exams. [Reason] This leaves little room for creative thinking or original ideas in the classroom. [Example] Students learn to memorize facts rather than explore complex concepts deeply. [Extension] Education needs to value diversity of creative thought much more than it currently does.

part3.question: Can creativity be learned, or is it an innate quality?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Creativity can be learned; one doesn't have to be a Jack of all trades [万金油] to be creative. [Reason] Specific creative skills can be taught and improved with practice. [Example] Anyone can learn to draw or write with the right teacher and dedication. [Extension] It is about unlocking one's inner creative potential [潜力] fully through constant effort.
